text: can you guess what today's color is do
you think it's green we are going in
order of the rainbow you know so today
we have reached green one of my favorite
colors because I love all the green

delicious very easy gonna roast a pork
loin with a little bit of garlic so the
first thing I'm doing is just breaking
off five cloves of garlic and you don't
even need to peel them so just take them
off the head I just like to remove my
garlic right off my discard bowl so all
this little paper goes right into the
bowl
just set those aside here I have a pork
loin put it on a rimmed baking sheet
it's a kind of small pork why not say
about a pound that's just enough for
four people you can always do a bigger
one surround it with the garlic cloves
season it season it on both sides then
just turn it fat side up and straight to
a 475 degree oven until it's about 138
240 in the very deepest part for 20 to
25 minutes while the pork is roasting
you can get a couple of other things
ready in this pot over here I have one
pound of new potatoes that are boiling
the big ones have been halved I'm
cooking them for about 13 minutes and
while they're cooking you can get your
kale ready take one bunch of kale and
remove the stem I'll show you how I like
to do it just turn it upside down so the
stem side is up and then hold the end
pull the green right off the stem and
then go back in and pull the other end
off just so you make sure you get all of
the kale off when you have all the stems
removed just to cut them into 1-inch
pieces you can just do this hoarsely add
your kale into your potatoes and cook it
for about two minutes you really just
want to wilt it down and just give it a
stir so that all of the kale is
submerged I feel like after you stir it
around once or twice it's done but if
you want to go ahead and cook it for
another minute or two minutes go ahead
drain it get rid of all that water shake
off the excess water and then right back
into the pot that you cooked it in
alright to that you're gonna add your
spin
stir in three cups of baby spinach and
you just want that to wilt down just a
tiny bit which is why you don't add it
with the potatoes and the kale while
they're cooking I'm just gonna leave
this to wilt just a tiny bit and go get
my pork when the work is done take it
out and tent it with foil for about 10
minutes while you finish the rest of
your dish the potatoes kale and spinach
will be dressed with lemon vinaigrette
you need about 2 tablespoons of lemon
juice
so I'd say with this really juicy lemon
about half a lemon don't forget to save
the other half 2 tablespoons of olive
oil salt and pepper that's it
that's all I mean by lemon vinaigrette
extremely simple couldn't be simpler
give it a stir
peel the garlic cloves and just throw
them whole right in with your potato

bit if you wanted to or you can mash
them and smear them on top of the pork
you can kind of do whatever you want
especially people don't like whole
cloves of roasted garlic but I think
it's a nice little surprise to get in
there now that the pork is have a chance
to rest you can carve it up remove the
strings you can cut them you can use
scissors or your knife when you cook
your pork to 138 like we do and let it
carry over to 145 it's slightly pink in

be really beautiful served on a platter
especially if you have company coming
but I'm just gonna serve up a plate
couple of slices of pork and plenty of

it's gonna make you feel really good
